[@alanz](@ZcjYF92reFjUtEYdoJ8ulOI6N6klwAAaIkghEEHdvSE=.ed25519) 

I just signed onto social.coop to see [this](https://social.coop/@nev/100645983676719086).

Sorry for pinging you above [@Mayel](@aTQuVwkglxM9TABZlDBk1NF4rqfe1v6yjyH+KFb3mPI=.ed25519) I didn't realize how much beef was currently happening. Fingers crossed that #SocialCoop survives, but it seems like it may be too tangled up in consensus. I've just spent a few minutes on the Matrix chat and it sounds like it's been going on for a while. Here's my best summary (in the hopes that someone in the future will correct me):

- deciding who to federate or block is controversial
- deciding what to host is controversial
- maintenance is hard and the Mastodon instance wasn't up-to-date
- the instance was too old to see cross-instance "reports" for abusive content
- governance is hard and the moderation jury struggled to keep everyone happy
- someone on the instance expressed that they were uncomfortable generalizing that Nazi = bad because ~"Nazi is a catch-all term"
- the members spoke out against the author but the post remained up
- other instances started blocking the instance for hosting Nazi normalization
- lots of discussion round and round in the Loomio and Matrix chat, but no action
- eventually the author left the instance and started somewhere else
- the instance is currently in crisis to resolve "social and technical debt"

I've probably screwed up the story, but hopefully Cunningham's Law comes into effect.

Potentially relevant: #against-consensus ( #againstconsensus )
